alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Logan; Sherman; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 21 at 4:05AM CDT until March 22 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Near Critical to Critical fire weather conditions expected Wednesday afternoon... .The combination of south to southwest winds gusting up to 55 mph and relative humidity values of 15 to 20 percent will produce Near Critical to Critical fire weather conditions in the watch area. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 013, 027, 028, 041, 042, 253, AND 254... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson and Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 013 Sherman, Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace, Fire Weather Zone 028 Logan, Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. * Timing...1 PM MDT (2 PM CDT) through 7 PM MDT (8 PM CDT). * Winds...South to southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 15 percent. * Temperatures...In the mid 70s. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised. Blowing dust is also possible and could create delays in response time of first responders due to limited visibility. Strong west winds are expected Wednesday evening, shifting to the north and decreasing in speed after midnight across the Fire Weather Watch area.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
